name: Sakura Angels
description: 日本語バージョンダウンロード開始されました。Two girls, blessed with magical powers, are faced with the task of saving the lonely protagonist from the clutches of a mysterious witch and ancient evil, sealed away long ago by his ancestors. What does this sorceress want from our protagonist?
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.2 GHz Pentium 4 Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 1280 x 720 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 200 MB available space

The two main characters, Sayaka and Hikari, should be on a comedy routine. They are complete opposites of eachother, Sayaka is loud and outgoing, while Hikari is grumpy and shy; creating many hilarious moments thoughout the game. They also drive the protagonist, Kenta, crazy with all their antics; I found myself chuckling many times at those scenes. I know that this game has a certain reputation, but it really is just a great game. It has funny characters, and amazing art, and I also found that I enjoyed this game even more than the first, Sakura Spirit. I absolutely recommend this game, and hope that the series will continue.
Cute game though there are not many actual choices to be made. Can be completed in 2 hours or so.
Bought it while it was one sale, not as good as Sakura Spirit but a few good pics here and there, got one fap, then refuded.  10/10 buy this game for 1 free fap valid for redemption at any time.

The best Japanese interactive novel I have ever played. I'm not talking about the boobs though. This game made me actually care for the charecters. The female charecters had complex personalities and aren't always drooling over the protaginist. This game also understands the interactive part of an interactive story because you can make decisions. The villian I felt a connection to because I have been in her shoes. The charecters feel like actual people and not just eye candy. I would recomend this game but I would also recomend playing it away from other people because there are some weird parts.

I later checked out with 69 boxes of tissues and 2 large heavy duty buckets. I ran out of tissues and both buckets were filled up within the first 15 minutes and I'm running out of things to contain all this 'glue'. Halp.

Okay, allow me to be clear. Sakura Angels isn't breaking records. It's fun to imagine what is actually happening animation style in your head. The cute Japanese voices definitely help give you a good image on how the characters would walk, move, interact and the like. The CG is beautiful. And the writing gets you giggling. The story doesn't take itself too seriously, and why should it? I'm not going to give any spoilers, but these girls definitely aren't culinary masters.  And now for me to complain a bit - Why is the CG so disconnected from the writing? It's a visual novel, if you're going to put the protagonist in particular situations, why not draw it? Yes, our imaginations are the ones that need to work here. But black screens would have been enough if you wanted that. There are so many points in the story where I really wanted to see what was happening. It's a visual novel, so let me see what I'm reading! Not to mention how many unanswered questions I have...  That aside, I'm glad I picked this up at the five dollar price. I can say that the tease is only worth that much. But pick it up if you can, because it's a mighty good tease, and there's going to be more, so support the artists and creators so that they can support us, and give us more of what we need. A deeper story with more characters (wouldn't mind seeing some male characters for diversity. There needs to be something there to make the story more intersting!) More CG to depict the various parts of the story (Be a visual novel more) and perhaps be clear with your aim for the choices. If they could branch more and allow the story to take different directions, that'd make the story fun to play multiple times. Or just make your story longer, and leave the choices as spice to make scenes slightly different. Either way it was a joy to read, and I definitely want more.  TL;DR version: Get it while it's cheap. It's worth the laugh, the awe and the distraction. Just not the full ten dollars.
Its like watching anime, you have few choices to make and overall i had a good experience. Wouldnt buy it for full price though.

I like anime. I like anime girls. I also like visual novels.  Not expecting much, I kinda liked the sister title, Sakura Spirit.  OK, let's try Sakura Angels.  As with Sakura Spirit, the heroines of Sakura Angels are cute, the art pretty, granted, but similarities end there. The short comings in Sakura Angels run too deep.  Actually, everything feels shorted and there is no depth.  Alas, Sakura Angels just can't really be called something that I like. -Too few plates (20 vs 30 for S. Spirit) -Too few backgrounds that do NOT reflect the story mood. -A miserable, borish protagonist coupled with -Terrible writing/ story telling  I tried to give the story a chance, I did. Heck, I finished it. But I did set it aside several times as the story line just couldn't keep my interest or the wimpy protagonist just irritated me to the Quit button....  There are a couple of narrative choices offered, likely slightly shifting the story and, apparently, affecting the gallery plates (still 2 short). However, I won't be putting myself through reading the story again just for a couple gallery pics.
♥♥♥ for the plot, stay for the plot. ;)

This is the second book in the Sakura series it is more tame than the first book and has the same story rich power that the first one has. The great part about this book is that the girls in this book all have more than one side that you can get to meet. This book does involve more choices that the first so you might have to play it twice to learn all about the girls. I would recomend this also becuase of the backgounds, these are really gorgeous and can be used as wallpapers. I hope you all enjoy the read as much as I did.

I really struggle to even call this a game. I've played several other 'visual novels' and by comparison Sakura Angels falls flat. Gameplay consists largely of clicking through text. There are perhaps a half dozen prompts that allow interaction beyond reading and clicking for the next text to pop up. The graphics, limited voice acting, and music are the only redeeming qualities of this 'game'.  Overall the story of Sakura Angels is mediocre. If this was an anime I'd probably turn it on while I worked on something else but the overarching story involving the protagonist is full of anime fanboy tropes and cliches. Most of the other characters are so incredibly one-dimensional and function more as props than full-blown characters.  I might buy this for half the given price as a distraction and to have the music and screenshots. Otherwise, I suggest players pass and try out other visual novels that offer more interactivity than Sakura Angels, otherwise there is plenty of manga/anime out there that offers better stories and won't result in carpal tunnel.

Im about Three in at this point. So far its a solid story, awesome art (not just because of partial clevage and striped panties). There are plenty of laughs to be had, there are options too! Who doesn't like options? Im not sure what the affect (so far). They might change the end? I dont know. But, it is a good game. Its like watching Anime, but with semi-still images, and people who fight by smashing in to each other. Good story, This isn't a game you get for gameplay, there is a lot of reading. The characters have been developing nicely thus far. Im not sure where I am at in the story, but it feels like it might end soon. I definintly want more stuff by these developers. Its a good 'Game'. I use quotation marks, as there is a lack of gameplay, but thats how it was designed. Its more of a visual novel, that you sometimes interact with. I'd personally give it a 78/100 so far. It only gets better as I go on. I did have to hold down space bar through some parts, as the computer is convinently placed in the kitchen, but I later re-visit these parts with the quick-load option, which is awesome for somthing like this. Makes it easy to see what other options do. So, all in all. Do I recommend this? Yea, but only if you are willing to read for hours on end. 78/100

Sakura Angels  If you're looking at this game you already know whether or not you want it, and likely you do. Buxom girls, a doofus protagonist, and some humor. I haven't read/played many visual novels so I can't compare it much, but it was interesting enough to go through at least once. Not sure how I'd feel about replaying it.  If you're into this sort of thing, give it a go. I'll likely pick up another Sakura title at some point.
